info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:34AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Franklin, southeastern Stephens, northern Hart, northern Anderson, southwestern Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through 500 AM EST... At 434 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Clemson to 8 miles south of Toccoa. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Seneca, Carnesville, Anderson, Central, Northlake, Pendleton, Reed Creek, Lavonia and Gumlog. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
